issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Enhancements to support Hadoop on Windows Server and Windows Azure environments

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.name: New Feature

fields.summary: Change untar to use Java API on Windows instead of spawning tar process

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

fields.description: HADOOP-8847 originally introduced this change on branch-1-win.  HADOOP-9081 ported the change to branch-trunk-win.  This should be simple to port to trunk, which would simplify the merge and test activity happening on HADOOP-8562.
fields.summary: port change to use Java untar API on Windows from branch-1-win to trunk

comments.body: Attaching testing tar files that will be required by the patch.  These files must be checked in manually during the commit.  The diff will not carry over binary files.

{color:red}-1 overall{color}.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12567409/HADOOP-9264.1.patch
  against trunk revision .

    {color:green}+1 @author{color}.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    {color:green}+1 tests included{color}.  The patch appears to include 1 new or modified test files.

    {color:green}+1 javac{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    {color:green}+1 javadoc{color}.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    {color:green}+1 eclipse:eclipse{color}.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    {color:green}+1 findbugs{color}.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    {color:green}+1 release audit{color}.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    {color:red}-1 core tests{color}.  The patch failed these unit tests in hadoop-common-project/hadoop-common:

                  org.apache.hadoop.fs.TestFileUtil

    {color:green}+1 contrib tests{color}.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/2126//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HADOOP-Build/2126//console

This message is automatically generated.
The test failure is expected, since the tar and tgz files needed for the test is not part of the patch. I ran the test manually and ensure that this test passes. I will commit it shortly.

Integrated in Hadoop-trunk-Commit #3307 (See [https://builds.apache.org/job/Hadoop-trunk-Commit/3307/])
    HADOOP-9264. Reverting r1441164 and wait for Jenkins results before committing the patch. (Revision 1441166)
HADOOP-9264. Port change to use Java untar API on Windows from branch-1-win to trunk. Contributed by Chris Nauroth. (Revision 1441164)

     Result = SUCCESS
